clinical_study.brief_title: In Vivo Clinical Trial of Porous Starch - Hydroxyapatite Composite Biomaterials for Bone Regeneration
clinical_study.official_title: In Vivo Clinical Trial of Porous Starch - Hydroxyapatite Composite Biomaterials for Bone Regeneration

brief_summary.textblock: Biodegradable scaffold is an accepted and commercialized medical alternative choice for bone regeneration. In this project we will used our new invention, porous starch- hydroxyapatite composite, for in vivo clinical trial.

detailed_description.textblock: The products were prepared from medical grade Thai rice starch mixed with high purity (>97%) hydroxyapatite powder from fresh cow bone, and already passed in vivo animal biocompatility test, then processed by freeze-drying. There were 44 volunteers from orthopedic and neurosurgical division, 4 and 40 patients, respectively.

primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome will be assessed from satisfactory grading by operative nurses and surgeons. Add a convenient storage, package removal, contamination risk, unused material disposal, size appropriateness, tolerability by hand, ease to cut, stability when wet, weight, and disturbance to operative field.

secondary_outcome.description: The short and long term safety and efficacy were assessed during real time operation, such as material dislodgement. Add a during follow up time for at least 1 months such as infection and allergic reaction by X-ray follow up assessment at 1, 3 and 6 months intervals, after operations.

arm_group.description: The groups were orthopedic patients and neurosurgical patients. The samples to fill the voiding space of bone and skull same as autografts.

intervention.description: Bone void filler device prepared from porous starch-hydroxyapatite composites for bone regeneration

study_pop.textblock: There were 44 volunteers from orthopedic and neurosurgical division.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- A patient who requires treatment by surgery and product implant in bone.
- Not indicate sex type
- 18-65 years
- Patients accepted participate in the study.
- Type of surgery will be treat for only bone.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Refused to join the study.
- Patients have an allergic history of carbohydrates and bovine bone.
